metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44225 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Keepalived through 2.2.4, the D-Bus policy does not sufficiently restrict the message destination, allowing any user to inspect and manipulate any property. This leads to access-control bypass in some situations in which an unrelated D-Bus system service has a settable (writable) property

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

keepalived - 1:2.2.4-0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: keepalived package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.4-0.2').
